Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of visa officer's decision and procedural fairness
Evidence_Assessment: Employer letter assessed as non-credible due to resemblance to NOC descriptions
Credibility_Factor: Officer questioned credibility of employer letter based on form and content
Legal_Rule: Reasonableness standard for substantive conclusions; correctness for procedural fairness
Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide procedurally fair assessment
Grounds_for_Claim: Unreasonable decision and breach of procedural fairness
Outcome_on_Merits: Decision found unreasonable and procedurally unfair
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Found lacking due to dismissal of credible evidence without sufficient justification
Key_Evidence_Considered: Employer letter detailing specific job functions and projects
Legal_Framework: Canadian administrative law and immigration regulations
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged denial based on insufficient consideration of work experience evidence
Court_Result: Decision quashed, case referred to a different officer
Legal_Rule_Source: Federal Court jurisprudence on reasonableness and procedural fairness
Defendant_Response: Did not adequately justify rejection of employer letter
Remedy_Requested: Quashing of decision and referral for reassessment
Remedy_Sought: Judicial review and re-determination by another officer
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Insufficient evidence of relevant work experience
Governing_Rule: Duty of procedural fairness and standard of reasonableness in administrative decisions
